tool.name: Microbiome Multivariable Association with Linear Models
tool.command: outlocation=$(mktemp -d) && outlocation2=$(mktemp -d) && Rscript /galaxy-central/tools/maaslin/Maaslin2/R/Maaslin2.R $taxonomy $metadata $outlocation --transform=AST --fixed_effects="diagnosis,dysbiosisnonIBD;dysbiosisUC,dysbiosisCD;antibiotics,age" --random_effects="site,subject" --normalization=NONE --standardize=FALSE --reference="diagnosis,nonIBD" && cp Rplots.pdf $output1 && zip -r $outlocation2/Maaslin2_Results.zip $outlocation && cp $outlocation2/Maaslin2_Results.zip $output2 && rm -r $outlocation && rm -r $outlocation2

data.name: output2
data.label: MaAsLin Output zip results - please download

tool.help:
.. _Maaslin2: https://github.com/biobakery/Maaslin2/ .. _Maaslin_Article: https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.01.20.427420
MaAsLin2 provides a comprehensive multi-model system for performing multivariable association testing in microbiome profiles, taxonomic, functional, or metabolomic - with analysis modules for preprocessing, normalization, transformation, and data-driven statistical modeling to tackle the challenges of microbial multi-omics (compositionality, overdispersion, zero-inflation, variable library size and high-dimensionality.
**Inputs** ==========
The MaAsLin 2 implementation requires two inputs:
* Microbial feature abundances (e.g. taxa, genes, transcripts, or metabolites) across samples, in either counts or relative counts * Environmental, clinical, or epidemiological phenotypes or covariates of interest (together “metadata”).
.. _Sample_Metadata: https://github.com/biobakery/Maaslin2/blob/master/inst/extdata/HMP2_metadata.tsv
.. _Sample_Taxonomy: https://github.com/biobakery/Maaslin2/blob/master/inst/extdata/HMP2_taxonomy.tsv
**Sample Data** ===============
You can download sample data to your computer from the following locations and then upload it to Galaxy using the Get-Data / Upload file from your computer.
**Please make sure to modify the Type from Auto-Detect to maaslin2_input** ===========================================================================
* Sample_Metadata_
* Sample_Taxonomy_
